column4: Hi - is there any terminal emulator that live-wraps output, or allows string search on the output?
string search is done via grep and piping usually
i.e. $ ls | grep html
Yes, but in the general case, the output that is already printed has to be copied and pasted to a file, then grepped.  That's inconvenient
oh you are trying to string search with interactive programs?
I want to search for some string throught all the that is already printed to the terminal, after some commands have been executed.
ah yes you will want to use a MODERN version of tintin++
all the text*
one with the #run command, it's a MUD client but can run any app including bash
thanks, I'll check it out
it's nice you can trigger certain events to cause other things to happen, because it was made for games
you could even try it as your default shell but make sure you have root available in case something bad happens (i.e. it doesn't want to run as a shell, and locks you out)
is it not too big/slow for use as a terminal client?  I'll try it...
I've missed string search for so long! Why isn't it implemented in xterm ages ago?? <sigh>
because tt++ is NOT a terminal
or a terminal emulator for that matter, it's an app that runs in a terminal.
you may also be interested in screen, which lets you have "tabs" in any terminal. though no greppage iirc
well I guess I can do the same with emacs... but that's just too slow and big. I want to be able to open a shell window in a second
I don't think emacs is that big unless you are running the X one
but I tend to like the "does just what you need" when it comes to CLI apps.
but emacs is slow to start.
I agree.  But none of the regular terminals do what I need :-/
yeah, which is why I didn't suggest it
yeah now you don't have to mess with getting unsupported packages
